speaker: Mary
text: *One sunny afternoon, Mary stumbled upon Rodney in the computer lab, his eyes squinting behind his glasses as he stared at lines of code on his screen.* Hey, Rodney!

speaker: Rodney
text: Hola, Mary! You come to join the dark side? *Rodney laughed, his eyes still fixed on the screen.*

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary laughed.* What are you working on?

speaker: Rodney
text: System penetration testing for a local business. They've hired me to hack into their system and expose any security flaws. It's fun stuff.

speaker: Mary
text: Really? That sounds fascinating.

speaker: Rodney
text: *Rodney finally looked up at her, a playful smirk on his face.* Interested in the underbelly of the digital world, are we?

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary shrugs.* Why not? Show me what you've got. *For the next hour, Rodney dove into his work, explaining the basics of penetration testing and cybersecurity, peppering his explanation with anecdotes of previous exploits. Mary listened, riveted. She never thought hacking could be so... ethical.*

speaker: Rodney
text: Here's the thing, *Rodney said suddenly, his dark eyes serious behind his glasses.* I do this to help people, not to hurt them.

speaker: Mary
text: That's... unexpectedly noble of you, Rodney. *teasing him*

speaker: Rodney
text: *Rodney grins, leaning back in his chair.* Well, I have my reasons.

speaker: Mary
text: Care to share? *Mary inquires, leaning forward, genuinely interested*

speaker: Rodney
text: *Rodney hesitated for a moment, then reached into his bag and pulled out his prayer book and the Icon of the Resurrection.*

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary blinks, surprised* I didn't know you were religious, Rodney.

speaker: Rodney
text: *Rodney nods.* Orthodox Christian. Have been for a while now.

speaker: Mary
text: Orthodox Christian? I've heard of Catholic and Protestant, but never Orthodox.

speaker: Rodney
text: *Rodney's eyes light up, the passionate twinkle Mary usually saw when he spoke about hacking.* It's... well, it's different. It's Christianity in its purest form, as practiced by the Apostles. We follow the traditions handed down to us by Christ's direct followers.

speaker: Mary
text: And the icon? *Mary asks, pointing at the object.*

speaker: Rodney
text: It's a holy image, used in prayer. This one is an icon of the Resurrection. It's a symbol of our belief in Christ's victory over death.

speaker: Mary
text: What made you choose this faith?

speaker: Rodney
text: *Rodney remains silent for a while, his gaze distant.* It was my parents. They were missionaries in Colombia. I wasn't particularly religious growing up, but seeing their faith in action... it inspired me.

speaker: Mary
text: Your parents were missionaries? That must've been interesting.

speaker: Rodney
text: To say the least. They didn't just preach the Gospel. They helped build communities, provided resources, loved the people. They showed me that faith is about love and service.

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary sits back, absorbing his words.*That's... beautiful, Rodney. I admire that. And it's unexpected, considering your... unique sense of humor.

speaker: Rodney
text: *Rodney laughs, his previous seriousness dissipating.* Yeah, well, God has a sense of humor too. Look at the platypus.

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary joins in his laughter.* Well, you've given me a lot to think about, Rodney. You're a unique blend of contradictions, and I must say, it's intriguing.

speaker: Rodney
text: *Rodney grins, shrugging nonchalantly.* Just being myself, Mary. Just being myself.
